title: landmark navigation
body: I would like to see a feature for navigating to "landmark regions" using the keyboard. Very similar to the way the F6 key works in the Windows Explorer (try it! :)

comments.body: Slack implemented landmark navigation using F6 (SHIFT+F6) in their desktop (Electron) app; or CTRL+F6 (CTRL+SHIFT+F6) in the browsers. It's quite nice. Please give it a try to get an idea of what this feature could feel like if implemented natively in browsers.

Here's the same feature request on other platforms (plus background discussion):
Safari: https://bugs.webkit.org/show_bug.cgi?id=172817
Chrome: https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=704698
Firefox: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=670928
Here's another little test site: http://pauljadam.com/demos/landmarks.html
Here's a really nice landmark and heading "explainer" page: https://www.w3.org/TR/wai-aria-practices/examples/landmarks/index.html
